channel.title: Iaido on World MJER Iaido Federation
channel.description: Recent content in Iaido on World MJER Iaido Federation

item.title: Information About the 11th Taikai
item.description: Notice of the 11th Taikai and Dan Examination of the World MJER Iaido Federation September 2, 2025 President: Kenichi Kobara Representative Director: Shuichi Mochizai In these days when unusual weather is becoming the norm, we trust that everyone is in good spirits and training diligently. We are pleased to announce that the annual Taikai and Dan Examination will be held again this year. We sincerely hope you will make plans

item.title: Information About Esaka Dojo Shibuya
item.description: To All Affiliated Dojos and Members, We hope this message finds you well, despite the record-breaking heat currently affecting Tokyo. We would like to inform you that the Shibuya Zoshukan Esaka Dojo, the founding dojo of our federation, will be unavailable for use for approximately two years starting from July 2025 due to major renovation work. As a result, all training sessions for the Esaka Dojo will be held exclusively

item.title: Registration Now Open for Boston Seminar 2025
item.description: Issued by Boston Iaido. Dear World MJER Iaido Federation Members, Boston Iaido last hosted the World MJER Iaido Federation Seminar in 2018. We are excited to announce that in 2025, Boston Iaido will once again host the seminar, which will take place from September 19 to 21 in Boston, Massachusetts. This seminar offers a wonderful opportunity to deepen your understanding of Muso Jikiden Eishin Ryu under the guidance of Federation

item.title: The 10th Taikai Information
item.description: 10th Tournament Information October 1, 2024 Federation Chairman: Kenichi Obara Representative Director: Hidekazu Mochi This summer has been marked by a long period of extreme heat, but we believe that our member swordsmen have been doing well. Now, as our federation enters its 16th term, we will be holding our annual demonstration tournament and promotion examination as outlined below, so we hope you will plan to participate. Date and time: Saturday, November 16, 2024, 9:00-16:30

item.title: Information About The9th Taikai
item.description: Dear, members. We are pleased to inform you that the 9th Taikai will be held on Saturday, November 18, 2023, at the Tokyo Budokan in Adachi-ku, Tokyo. Please note that this venue is distinct from the Nippon Budokan. For this event, we have planned a two-part program: Enbu for Esaka sensei Shinsa Your presence and participation would be greatly appreciated. World MJER Iaido Federation Â© æ­£çµ±æ­£æµç„¡

item.title: R.I.P. Esaka Sensei
item.description: Dear Members, We deeply regret to inform you that Esaka Seigen sensei passed away at the hospital on July 29, 2023. He was 97 years old. We are immensely grateful for his unwavering dedication to Iaido and his invaluable guidance to each and every one of us. Rest in peace, æ±Ÿå‚é™åš´å…ˆç”Ÿ. item.title: About Esaka Sensei Resigned
item.description: Dear members. Esaka Sensei was resigned from his post as the Representative Director of World MJER Iaido Federation on May 30, 2021. He said “Because of I’m getting older, and my strength declining”. Then, Esaka sensei designated Kobara sensei(Chairman of Genshin-Kan) as new representative Director. And we decided to new representative Director of World MJER Iaido Federation is Kobara sensei. The “Taikai” held in November will be canceled as it

item.title: Notice Cancellation of The9th Taikai2020
item.description: Dear members. Due to concerns over the spread of Coronavirus(COVID-19), we regretfully announce the cancellation of The 9th Taikai2020. However, Shinsa (exam) will be held on November, 2020 at Matsudo Esaka Dojo. (If the condition of the coronavirus is similar to the present.) The deadline for application is September 30. Stay safe. item.title: A Happy New Year2020
item.description: Dear members. New Year greetings from World MJER Iaido Federation. Last year we had many participants in “the 10th anniversary of the Federation” the 8th taikai. I appriciate it very much. We are all praying for your health and heartiness for in order to pass on the orthodox style of the Eishin Ryu Iaido style to future generations. Thank you. Chairman Esaka Hiroshi Seigen Representative Director Yoshioka Kazunari Cheif-Instructor Director

item.title: The 8th Taikai Close
item.description: Novermber 4th, 2019. We held Federation 10th anniversary “the 8th taikai” at Kamata, Tokyo. Opening ceremony. A letter of appreciation was given by Esaka sense to those who cooperated in the development of the World MJER Iaido Federation. Tachi Uchi no Kurai. Enbu ~ Shinsa Awards ceremony. more pics available on here. A party after the 8th taikai. World MJER Iaido Federation 10th anniversary party. more pics available on here.

item.description: Esaka Senseiâ€™s book: â€œAn introduction to MJER Iaidoâ€ English version #04: P548 Conclusion In the fall of 1955, in the gymnasium of Shioiri Elementary School in Yokosuka City, Kanagawa Prefecture, I saw my first iaido demonstration. As I would learn in later years, the swordsman was Hanshi Sano Shigenori Sensei. Even today, I vividly remember how

item.description: Esaka Senseiâ€™s book: â€œAn introduction to MJER Iaidoâ€ English version #03: P5 Overview of Iaido (2) School Name After being founded by Hayashizaki Jinsuke Shigenobu (the 1st Headmaster), the way of Hayashizaki Muso-ryu was passed down from generation to generation, producing many experts. In particular, the Seito 7th Headmaster, Hasegawa Chikaranosuke Hidenobu, earned renown as the

item.title: Seito 20th Headmaster and Seito 21st Headmaster
item.description: As mentioned above, for a long time, until the Seito 19th Headmaster, the style of Muso Jikiden Eishin-ryu was passed on down the generations without leaving Tosa Province, but at the start of the Showa Era (1926), the Osaka branch of the Dai Nippon Butoku Kai association, recognizing the true value and importance of iaido, advocated its practice along with kendo and judo. From then, the Headmaster was invited from Kochi Prefecture each year, and for around 20 years, he held training sessions that were a great success, with around 20,000 people taking part.

item.title: Precepts of Master KÅno Hyakuren
item.description:
Precepts of Master KÅno Hyakuren, 20 th Head of the MusÅ-jikiden Eishin-ryu School of Iaido
I sincerely hope that those who seek to learn the teachings of this school will maintain throughout their training a firm resolution to correctly transmit to later practitioners the forms of our school that former masters have handed down from ancient times to the present day, absolutely uncolored by personal philosophy and in no way altered.
